alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Worcester, southeastern Hampshire, southeastern Franklin and east central Hampden Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Belchertown, or 8 miles southeast of Amherst, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain with localized flooding, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Ludlow, Holden, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Palmer, Spencer, Athol, Ware, Rutland, Granby, Barre, Warren, Paxton, North Brookfield, Hubbardston, West Brookfield, Hardwick, Oakham, Phillipston and Pelham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
